bibl.title: Albert B. Martin v. United States. Hearing.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: In the matter of the application of Arthur B. Martin for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Now on this day this cause comes on for hearing, Geo. P. Fishburne appearing for the Government and Arthur B. Martin attorney per se, and the Court having heard the arguments of counsel for the Government and the statement of the Petitioner, and being fully advised in the premises, now denies the prayer of said petitioner, and sirects that the Clerk's costs and Marshal's costs herein and the petitioner's board from the date of this petition be paid out of funds belonging to said petitioner in the hands of the Immigration Commissioner.
In re applciation of Arthur B. Martin for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Now ont his day the Petitioner comes in open Court to apply for Writ of Habeas Corpus, Albert Moody, appearing for the Governmnet, and on motion of counsel for Governmnet hearing on application is continuted until October 14, 1914, at 2.00 P..M.
